channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ardoyne baby death: Mother in court charged with murder
item.description: Raluca Tagani is accused of the murder of her son Liam O'Keefe in Belfast on Tuesday.

item.title: Bank of Ireland: Woman awarded £18k in sexual harassment case
item.description: The sexual harassment was serious and repeatedly violated the woman's dignity, a tribunal found.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Frantic' efforts to fix NI Covid passport system
item.description: The online system has been out of action since Tuesday due to concerns about data security.

item.title: Covid-19: Three more deaths and 1,101 new cases in NI
item.description: Three people have died within 28 days of testing positive for Covid-19 in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI Protocol issues raised at north-south meeting
item.description: It comes as the DUP issues a fresh warning over its involvement in north-south engagement.

item.title: Out-of-hours GP services cut back in the Southern Trust area
item.description: Armagh, South Tyrone and Kilkeel centres will close until at least the end of August.

item.title: Northern Ireland food and drink sector worth £5bn a year
item.description: The sector provides jobs for almost 25,000 people with sales up 4% on the previous year.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records increase in NI's virus-related deaths
item.description: Nine deaths were registered in the week up to last Friday, a rise of six from the previous week.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Windsor Park to be at 70% capacity for final in 11 August
item.description: Up to 13,000 fans will attend the Uefa Super Cup final between Chelsea and Villareal at Windsor Park in Belfast on 11 August

item.title: Ballymena: Rare cancer diagnosis leads to unlikely friendship
item.description: Cat McKenna and Amber Scott met after being diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Aidan Walsh guaranteed at least bronze medal after quarter-final win
item.description: Belfast boxer Aidan Walsh is guaranteed at least a bronze medal at the Tokyo Games after defeating Merven Clair of Mauritius in his welterweight quarter-final.

item.title: Covid-19: NI Executive to relax travel isolation rules
item.description: Vaccinated EU and US travellers coming to Northern Ireland will not need to quarantine from 2 August.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccination plea after cancer surgeries cancelled
item.description: A health trust chief says there is a "direct link" between unvaccinated people and the cancellations.

item.title: High street voucher scheme: £100 cards 'to be available in September'
item.description: Every adult in Northern Ireland can receive a voucher if they are on the updated electoral register.

item.title: Féile an Phobail asks for proof of Covid status
item.description: Féile an Phobail asks attendees for proof of a negative test, vaccinations or antibodies.

item.title: Covid: How is furlough changing and when will it end?
item.description: Employers will contribute more to the cost of keeping their staff furloughed from 1 August.

item.title: Covid-19: NI furlough claims fell to 44,000 by end of June
item.description: The scheme is being wound down further this weekend and is due to close at the end of September.

item.title: NI Covid-19 restrictions: Your questions answered
item.description: BBC News NI sets out the latest steps ministers are taking to ease Northern Ireland's lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: Getting back on stage will 'feel like Christmas'
item.description: Two young actors cannot wait to perform live in front of an indoor audience on Tuesday.

item.title: Missing ring found by father-and-son detectorists at Downhill
item.description: Metal detectorists Andy and Ryan McCloy came to the rescue after a bride-to-be's social media appeal.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Ballywatticock: What is the origin of NI weather station names?
item.description: Ballywatticock had its moment in the sun but what is its origin that of other weather station names?

item.title: Omagh ruling: Victims' families and politicians react
item.description: Victims' families and politicians respond to the judgement in case linked to Omagh bomb.

item.title: Belfast: Archaeology students stumble across Neolithic find
item.description: The QUB students were looking for 18th and 19th century artefacts in Stranmillis in south Belfast.

item.title: Bank of Ireland harassment case 'shows employers must protect women'
item.description: Natasha McNicholl says it was two years after she won a sexual harassment case that an anonymity order was lifted.

item.title: NI abortion: Givan 'will resist' government order to Stormont
item.description: The first minister is taking legal advice and is prepared to go to court to block abortion services.

item.title: High street voucher scheme: £100 cards coming in September, says minister
item.description: The £100 high street voucher scheme for Northern Ireland will open in September, says a minister.

item.title: Londonderry: Man taken to hospital after stabbing
item.description: The man was found with injuries to his neck in the early hours of Thursday morning.

item.title: Londonderry: Boy held after 14-year-old assaulted is released
item.description: It follows an incident in the Clon Elagh area of the city in the early hours of Wednesday.

item.title: North west floods support scheme opens for farmers
item.description: The £2.7m scheme opens almost four years since record rainfall fell on the north west.

item.title: New exhibition explores life along Derry-Donegal border
item.description: The production, entitled Borderlands, will feature interviews from 22 people living in border areas.

item.title: Rowers win Ireland's first gold at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: Ireland win their first gold medal of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games as Paul O'Donovan and Fintan McCarthy claim the lightweight men's double sculls.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish PM says no jab needed to return to office
item.description: Micheál Martin also praised the country's vaccine roll-out for being "way ahead" of EU averages.

item.title: Irish Sea rescue after man spends 10 hours in water
item.description: The man is "stressed but stable" after his ordeal in the Irish Sea off the coast of County Louth.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish vaccine programme to include 12-15-year-olds
item.description: Taoiseach (Irish PM) Micheál Martin says it represents a "significant opening up" of the programme.

item.title: Ronan Keating accepts phone hacking damages
item.description: The ex-Boyzone singer's lawyers told the High Court of the distress caused by newspapers stories.
